Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, containing many white inclusions, and red-grey in section, the interior is thickly-caked with a yellow-brown deposit, the exterior is covered with light-brown slip and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:30-31 House T36.59.I.27
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393612) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393612)
